intro: Faroa pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf faroa, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid, tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
